page.title: 16RELIGION
page.content: Though only a small town, Pitlochry has five churches. Each church has a regular congregation ranging from 50 in the Baptist church to 300 in the Church of Scotland. Summer visitors swell these numbers considerably, particularly the Catholic church with something like a 400% increase. Females, over thirty, form the main congregation, though this can also change in the summer months. The Sunday schools have a healthy attendance. Perhaps because of the composition of population in the area, church going is still seen as a normal activity, though from a school survey, it appears more from a sense of duty than deep religious belief. About 30% of the pupils are regular visitors to church.
